intro: Castilleja integra var. gloriosa, commonly known as the golden paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to yellow tubular flowers. The plant lacks true leaves and relies on its host plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its striking appearance makes it a popular subject in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
